value.title: DAX Fridays! #184: Show last label only on a line chart in Power BI
value.excerpt: Displaying only the last label on a line chart is quite a common scenario that is not supported in Power BI by default, so in today's vide I am going to show you how to do that with a little bit of DAX magic!  And sorry I forgot the link to the blog: https://datastud.dev/pages/projects  Here you can

value.title: DAX Fridays #214: Create DAX calculations on ranges taken from a slicer!!

Sales variance between multiple years 2. Rank across multiple years and many more!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #23: ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: In this video we will through the ISFILTERED function in DAX. value.title: DAX Fridays! #30: SEARCH vs FIND
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! tutorial we are going to go though examples on how to use two DAX functions: SEARCH and FIND  SEARCH and FIND DAX functions are used to find the number of characters at which a specific word is found in a column. value.title: DAX Fridays! #96: MEDIAN, AVERAGE, MEAN, MODE | The Bill Gates Effect
value.excerpt: In part 2 of the data profiling series, we are going to talk about MEAN, AVERAGE, MODE AND MEDIAN and try to explain them with a story, what I call the Bill Gates Effect.  Main topics?  Is average a good measure ? When is average a bad metric to use? Calculate median Calculate mode.  Here is the website
